revised_title: Subcritical Crack Growth: Fatigue, Creep, and Stress Corrosion Cracking
tldr: This article examines the factors that determine crack growth rates for various time-dependent cracking processes, including fatigue, creep, and stress corrosion. It discusses the behavior of sharp cracks in ductile metals under load and the mechanisms and laws controlling crack advance by these processes. The article also comments on creep-fatigue and corrosion-fatigue crack growth.
